Perhaps I have a warped sense of high-test-coverage but I have always taken=

it to mean

    =B3covering all of the most likely cases and even most of =
the unlikely
cases=B2

not just

    =B3one test per unit=B2.

With this de=
finition I would assume that approaching 100% is possible, but
getting 100%=
 is improbable.  In my 7+ years of unit testing, test-first, and
TDD I have=
 never developed a system in which I would be confident saying I
had 100% t=
est coverage.  Maybe I am too much of a skeptic.

Jason
